message_1: Suppose a sample of a radioactive substance has an initial mass of 200 grams and a half-life of 10 days. Find the mass of the sample after 30 days assuming that the decay follows the exponential decay model.
message_2:
To solve this problem, we'll use the exponential decay formula:

Final mass = Initial mass * (1/2)^(time elapsed / half-life)

In this case, the initial mass is 200 grams, the half-life is 10 days, and the time elapsed is 30 days. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Final mass = 200 * (1/2)^(30 / 10)

Final mass = 200 * (1/2)^3

Final mass = 200 * (1/8)

Final mass = 25 grams

So, after 30 days, the mass of the radioactive substance will be 25 grams.
